item.title: Chiefs win showdown with Chargers to surge back into AFC West lead
item.description: Kansas City blasted past Los Angeles on Saturday to score a second straight win over a fellow AFC West front-runner and close in on the division title.

item.title: Packers activate Rodgers for Panthers game
item.description: The Green Bay Packers have activated quarterback Aaron Rodgers, who is coming back from a broken collarbone suffered Oct. 15 against the Minnesota Vikings.

item.title: Source: Fournette out as Jags eye playoff berth
item.description: With the Jaguars trying to clinch their first playoff berth since 2007, RB Leonard Fournette will be held out vs. the Texans with a sore quad, a source told ESPN's Chris Mortensen.

item.title: Source: JuJu likely to play; Pats' Van Noy out
item.description: The Patriots downgraded linebacker Kyle Van Noy to out for Sunday's game against Pittsburgh because of a calf injury. Steelers receiver JuJu Smith-Schuster, questionable with a hamstring injury, is expected to play, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

item.title: Steelers duo, Brady get most Pro Bowl votes
item.description: Steelers RB Le'Veon Bell received the most fan votes for the Pro Bowl, followed by Patriots QB Tom Brady and Steelers WR Antonio Brown. The top NFC vote getter is Eagles QB Carson Wentz. The Rams are represented by RB Todd Gurley and QB Jared Goff.

item.title: Panthers owner facing misconduct allegations
item.description: Panthers owner and founder Jerry Richardson is the subject of a workplace misconduct investigation, the team announced Friday.

item.title: Falcons' Coleman ruled out vs. Buccaneers
item.description: Atlanta Falcons' running back Tevn Coleman has been ruled out of Monday night's game against the Tampa Bay Buccaneers with a concussion.

item.title: Gronk deflects suspension-related questions
item.description: Patriots tight end Rob Gronkowski says he learned from his mistake that led to a one-game suspension, but he brushed off questions about reaching out to Tre'Davious White and cut his news conference short.

item.title: Week 15 fantasy football rankings
item.description: Will Le'Veon Bell run wild against the Patriots? See where our experts place him and all the key players for Week 15.

item.title: Week 15 fantasy football inactives watch
item.description: AJ Mass provides updated inactives and analysis based on the latest reports and official announcements leading up to kickoff.

item.title: Fantasy football injury outlooks for Week 15
item.description: Wondering what you can expect from players who are dealing with injuries in Week 15? Injury expert Stephania Bell gives her thoughts on each notable player.

item.title: NFL Playoff Picture: How Week 15 can affect seeding
item.description: This weekend could determine two division titles, up to three playoff berths and more. Here's how the field looks now and what can change.

item.title: Predictions: Scores for every game
item.description: Playoff berths are at stake for several teams, with Chargers-Chiefs on Saturday and Patriots-Steelers on Sunday among the top matchups.

item.title: Biggest Week 15 questions, stats and predictions
item.description: One of the biggest weekends of the regular season has a huge Pats-Steelers showdown, Aaron Rodgers' return, a telling test for the Rams and more.

item.title: Lions showed potential in win over Bears, but are they trustworthy?
item.description: Detroit clinched a .500 season and stayed in the playoff hunt with their win over Chicago, but is this truly a team capable of making a run?

item.title: Stafford moves past Romo in all-time passing yards
item.description: Matthew Stafford eclipsed Tony Romo in career passing yards in the third quarter Saturday, shortly after becoming the youngest QB to hit 34,000 yards.

item.title: Why Steelers want home field? Antonio Brown's red velvet cake, for starters
item.description: Everything is better at home, including the team's traditional red velvet cake, provided by Brown since 2015.

item.title: Next -- last? -- chapter for Big Ben: Slaying Patriots dragon
item.description: Ben Roethlisberger won't say it, but Sunday's game against the Patriots is about more than playoff seedings; it's a chance to cement his NFL legacy.

item.title: Deflated in Philly: Fans react to Carson Wentz and the curse on their town
item.description: The star QB's torn ACL did more than just lay waste to the Eagles' plans. It also ripped the scab off an old wound the size of the Delaware Valley.

item.title: Dak Prescott won't change style after seeing Wentz's injury
item.description: Prescott says the threat of serious injury is "part of the game," but the Cowboys want him weighing the risks vs. rewards when he's a runner.

item.title: Browns, Bills and 49ers set up for big 2018 draft
item.description: Three teams traded up to select their quarterbacks of the future in 2017. Now three others are armed with lots of capital, but not all will take a QB.

item.title: How important is beating Rams? Seahawks' NFC West chances would drop to 3 percent if they don't
item.description: The stakes couldn't be higher for the banged-up Seahawks when the Rams visit Sunday. We examine the keys to the game, including pressuring Jared Goff.

item.title: The day that Aaron Rodgers told Thomas Davis: 'Dang, old man, you've still got it'
item.description: As Davis prepares to face Rodgers again, he fondly remembers one play years ago when he ran down the star QB and got a prized reaction.

item.title: Protecting Jimmy Garoppolo top priority for Niners against Titans
item.description: Check out three things to watch for from San Francisco's perspective in its upcoming game against Tennessee.

item.title: Rookie of the Year races: Where they stand, how they could finish
item.description: Kareem Hunt emerged as the early favorite for the offensive award, but a midseason slump cracked the field wide open. NFL Nation reporters make cases for the top five candidates on both sides of the ball.

item.title: The 10 most effective #ProBowlVote tweets
item.description: What follows are the 10 posts that got the most retweets during public Pro Bowl voting, based on ESPN research.

item.title: Run the Table 2.0 would rank high among Aaron Rodgers' feats
item.description: The Packers QB will play Sunday for the first time since he broke his right collarbone on Oct. 15, and Green Bay has no room for error.

item.title: What to expect in Rodgers' return? Check the film from 2013
item.description: Rodgers, who is set to return from a broken collarbone this week, was in a similar spot four years ago. He was a bit rusty, but still clutch.

item.title: Week 15 NFL betting nuggets
item.description: Rob Nelson identifies betting nuggets to know for this week's NFL action.

item.title: Super Bowl LII odds for all 32 NFL teams
item.description: The New England Patriots are still the favorites to win Super Bowl LII. Here are the odds from the Westgate Las Vegas Super Book for each of the 32 NFL teams.
